mdRecord.dcterms:title: South Rose Window, interior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Armstrong, Maitland (American stained glass artist, New York City, 1836-1918) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: There are 14 stained-glass windows in the sanctuary or auditorium of Judson Memorial Church, and 3 in the main stairwell. All but the rose window in the chancel were designed by John La Farge between 1892 and 1910; they were manufactured by the Decorative Stained Glass Company and Thomas Wright between 1892 and 1915. The designer of the rose window is presently unknown but may have been D. Maitland Armstrong, a contemporary and friend of John La Fargeâ€™s. [work]
